[http://www.nantes.fr nantes.fr] }} 'Nantes' () (, Gallo: Naunnt) is a city in
West France, located on the Loire River, from the Atlantic
coast. [http://encyclopedia.farlex.com/Nantes Nantes] Hutchinson
Encyclopedia. Retrieved 14 August 2007. The city is the 6th largest in
France, while its metropolitan area ranks 8th with nearly 900,000 inhabitants. [http://www.populationdata.net/pays/europe/france-
villes.php Population des villes de France au dernier recensement]
PopulationData.net. Retrieved 14 August 2007

Nantes, labeled art and history city, is the capital city of the Pays de la
Loire region and the Loire-Atlantique dÃ©partement and also the largest city in
the Grand-Ouest, North western France in English. Together with Vannes, Rennes
and Carhaix, it was one of the major cities of the historic province of
Brittany, and the ancient Duchy of Brittany. Though officially separated from
Brittany in 1789, The 4 August 1789. It has not been part of any official
Brittany since this date. Nantes is culturally Breton and still widely
regarded as its capital
city. [http://travel.nytimes.com/2007/08/05/travel/05next.html?ref=travel A
New Luster in the Ancient Heart of Brittany] [[The New York Times]], 5 August
2007. Retrieved 7 August 2007.

The City's Tramway system the Nantes Tramway, opened in 1985 and re-introduced
today's modern tramways in France and in Europe, reversing the trend of tramway
closures that had been going on since the middle of the 20th century and
becoming the first in a wave of tramways built from scratch. The Nantes tramway
system is one of the largest and busiest in France. The city also has a Busway
line, an innovative and notable Bus Rapid Transit. Nantes is served by an
international airport, Nantes Atlantique Airport and a major French railway
station, the Gare de Nantes.

In 2004, ''Time'' named Nantes as "the most liveable city in Europe". [http://www.time.com/time/europe/secret/nantes.html The Last Best
Place In Europe] Time Europe, 22 August 2004. Retrieved 4 August 2007. In
2010, Nantes was named a hub city for innovation in the Innovation Cities Index
by innovation agency, 2thinknow. The city was ranked 36th globally
from 289 cities and 4th overall in France, behind Paris, Lyon and Strasbourg for
innovation across multiple sectors of the economy. As of 2013, Nantes
holds the title of European Green Capital awarded by the European
Commission for its efforts to reduce air pollution and CO 2
emissions, for its high quality and well-managed public transport system and for
its biodiversity with 3,366 hectares of green spaces and several Natura 2000
zones which guarantee a protection of nature in the area.
